newsitem.title: UK: N. Sea crude firmer as Iraqi news inspires rally.
newsitem.headline: N. Sea crude firmer as Iraqi news inspires rally.

text.p: North Sea crudes followed Brent higher on Monday after the United Nations delayed Iraq's oil-for-food deal, but activity was thin as the market awaited the next development from the Gulf.

October Brent rallied to $22.00 per barrel, its highest level since April, in the late afternoon on a shortened trading day due to the U.S. Labor Day holiday. Intermonth Brent spreads gained about 10 cents across the board. Sept/Oct and Oct/Nov both traded up to +65 cents.
Dated Brent also firmed by 10 cents to trade at October paper +24 cents, versus +15 cents on Friday.
